ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: In this class, I got a very cursory overview of different forms of art historical analysis and different strategies to improve my writing.
I learned a great deal about art history as a field and in theory.
Great class with insightful info about the major
Learned about the theoretical approaches to art history through reading essays by a variety of art historians, artists, historians, anthropologists, and more.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The readings in the course gave very good overviews of the week's theme. Some of them were a bit dated but interesting nonetheless. Because the topics were all so different the quality of discussion varied from week to week.

It really is wonderful to take advantage of the collection on a weekly basis and engage with peers on various ideas and aspects of artworks. It would be nice to hear from everyone more consistently rather than spending more time on two works.

The professor and the weekly writing assignments made this class very unique. The one thing I would add was to have more time spent in the gallery itself looking at the art. This is where our best class discussion occurred.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Though geared towards art history majors, it is useful for anyone to understand how artwork and academia are studied and discussed.
Absolutely! Especially to HSAR majors (hence why it is required)! The class material will be incredibly helpful in my other classes.
